org.restlet.ext.raml

Class RamlApplication

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.restlet.Restlet
      • org.restlet.Application
        • org.restlet.ext.raml.RamlApplication
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Uniform
    Deprecated. 
    Will be removed in next minor release.

    @Deprecated
public class RamlApplication
extends Application
    RAML enabled application. This subclass of Application can describe itself in the format described by the RAML specification project.

    It requires you to set up a specific end point that serves the RAML definition.

    By default, nothing is required. This application adds to its inbound root the endpoint ("/raml"). You can override this behavior by using the RamlApplication#attachRaml* methods
    By default, the description is generated by introspecting the application itself. You can override this behavior by specifying your own implementation of RamlSpecificationRestlet.
    Author:
    Cyprien Quilici

        Deprecated. 
        Defines the route on which the Raml definition will be provided.
        Parameters:
        router - The router on which defining the new route.
        ramlPath - The path to which attach the Restlet that serves the RAML definition.
        ramlRestlet - The Restlet that serves the RAML definition.

      • getInboundRoot

        public Restlet getInboundRoot()
        Deprecated. 
        Overrides the parent's implementation. It checks that the application has been documented using a RamlSpecificationRestlet. By default, the documentation is attached to the high level router, with the "/raml" path.
        Overrides:
        getInboundRoot in class Application
